session_synopses.001: A merregon - a footsoldier from hell assigned to assist the Orthon ( a huge infernal bounty hunter). Outside of combat, the merregon is unspeaking and unreactive. Upon attempting to read its thoughts, you realise it's little more than an empty vessel, without personality or thought.
session_synopses.000: One of the merregon henchmen accompanying the orthon in his lair in the Shar Temple. This one acts as a trader and beastmaster for the Orthon's displacer beast. The player can trade, learn about the merregon's connection to the displacer via detect thoughts, and convince it to hand over the potions used to control the beast.
session_synopses.006: A merregon - a footsoldier from hell assigned to assist the Orthon ( a huge infernal bounty hunter). Outside of combat, the merregon is unspeaking and unreactive, uttering only slight groans and rattling sighes. Upon attempting to read the thoughts of one of its comrades, you realise it's little more than an empty vessel, without personality or thought.vessel, without personality or thought.

PAD_Ambush.speaker: Player
PAD_Ambush.context: NodeContext: Urgent/just been ambushed by a cloaker (a big bat/manta ray-looking creature)

session_synopses.PAD_Ambush: The party reacts to being ambushed by a Cloaker in the Gauntlet of Shar

PAD_SpearLoot.speaker: Player
PAD_SpearLoot.text: This is no common spear... It must be the one that Shadowheart is supposed to find.

AD_SilencePlayer.context: NodeContext: Creepy ghost-whisper, spoken in combat.

session_synopses.PAD_OpenedScrollDoor: Party expresses affirmation that the button opened the door.
session_synopses.PAD_SpearLoot: Voicebark when picking up the Spear of the Night. A sacred Sharran relic and vital for Shadowheart's quest to kill Nightsong.
session_synopses.AD_SilencePlayer: Combat reaction for the Dark Justiciar ghosts in the Silent Library. When the player disturbs them they will silence the player . On the third disturbance they become hostile
session_synopses.AD_RiddlePlaque: Reads out the riddle on the plaque.

PAD_RecognisedSharTemple.speaker: Player
PAD_RecognisedSharTemple.text: Some sort of temple? Looks abandoned.

session_synopses.PAD_RecognisedSharTemple: When the player first enters the Shar Temple they roll History to recognise it as the Gauntlet of Shar - an infamous training ground. If the player is Shadowheart, a Sharran, or a Selunite they automatically succeed

node_data.speaker: Displacer Beast
node_data.text: What was that? I feel strange... clear.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: The orthon sold you to me. I'm your master now.
False

node_data.speaker: Displacer Beast
node_data.text: You lie. Your breath stinks of double-speak.

session_synopses: Appears if the player tries to speak to the Displacer Beast. The player can learn that the beast is in love with the Orthon, and if they know that it has been charmed by him, they can attempt to convince it to join them in battle against the Orthon.

PAD_MintharaReaction.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
PAD_MintharaReaction.text: I wish I could kill that bloated sack of offal, but he may yet help us reach Ketheric.

AD_EnemyVulnerable.speaker: Balthazar
AD_EnemyVulnerable.text: We have the upper hand - do your work, Flesh!

AD_OrderingGhouls.speaker: Balthazar
AD_OrderingGhouls.text: Embalming fluid, and a pipette. Now.
AD_OrderingGhouls.context: NodeContext: Ordering his ghould minions about

AD_StartTurn.speaker: Balthazar
AD_StartTurn.text: It will be a kindness to put an end to your follies.

GolemInvitation.speaker: Flesh
GolemInvitation.context: CinematicNodeContext: The door to Balthazar's private chambers open, revealing a flesh golem. It utters a gurgle and beckons the player to enter.InternalNodeContext: Note - if the flesh golem is somehow unavailable, an alternate invitation will trigger with the necormancer instead.

AD_Justiciar_TakingTurn_2.speaker: Justiciar Avenger
AD_Justiciar_TakingTurn_2.context: NodeContext: Rasped, wraithlike battle taunt, directed at a trespassing necromancer

Barricade.speaker: Reconstituted Duellist
Barricade.text: My creations are my pride and joy. I shall kill you for attacking them.

Barricade.speaker: Reconstituted Duellist
Barricade.text: Afraid I'd ruin these things' looks? Make good on your threat, or else stand aside.

Barricade.speaker: Reconstituted Duellist
Barricade.text: These are masterworks. Perhaps you'll join their ranks, once I repurpose your corpse.

AD_Justiciar_CombatStarts.speaker: Justiciar Avenger
AD_Justiciar_CombatStarts.context: NodeContext: Rasped, wraithlike battle taunt. MER-kul

AD_LowHP.speaker: Balthazar
AD_LowHP.text: Fool. You think striking down my body will be the end of me?

session_synopses.PAD_MintharaReaction: When dialogue with Balthazar ends (or his projection that delivers the narrative bit) this PAD is played by Minthara in party.
session_synopses.AD_EnemyVulnerable: Balthazar orders his flesh golem to attack his enemy while they're vulnerable
session_synopses.AD_OrderingGhouls: Balthazar gives some orders to his ghouls while in the Shar temple. He tells them to fetch things related to his necromancy (he's busy repairing some of his undead troops)
session_synopses.AD_StartTurn: Balthazar gloats at and taunts the player before acting during his turn
session_synopses.AD_GolemDead: Balthazar is angry at his flesh golem being killed
session_synopses.GolemInvitation: Balthazar's private chambers are unlocked and his flesh golem invites the players inside to talk
session_synopses.AD_Justiciar_TakingTurn_2: Justiciar that attacks Balthazar in his lair in Shar temple. Need to have same or similar voice to other Dark Justiciars
session_synopses.AD_Death: Balthazar's final words as he dies
session_synopses.Barricade: The player is challenged by some skeleton warriors at a barricade outside the Necromancer's lair. The necromancer speaks through the dead warriors - his words in their dessicated voices.(this mayor may not follow on from an earlier scene with more skeletons controlled by the necromancer). A mindmeld convinces the necromancer to command his skeletons to grant entry. The scene ends with combat with the skeletons, or a shadowquake triggering a fight between player (+ skeletons) against sharran wraiths. Afterwards, the player is invited into Balthazar's inner sanctum.
session_synopses.AD_BarricadeLeader: The lead skeleton defending Balthazar's room will attempt to grab the players' attention
session_synopses.AD_Justiciar_CombatStarts: Justiciar that attacks Balthazar in his lair in Shar temple. Need to have same or similar voice to other Dark Justiciars
session_synopses.PAD_DefeatedNecro: The players comment on Balthazar's death
session_synopses.AD_DominateGolem: Balthazar scolds his flesh golem as he calms it down
session_synopses.AD_LowHP: Balthazar defiantly reacts to being critically injured

AD_Plaque.speaker: Narrator
AD_Plaque.text: *Feed your bodies and rest your minds. Lady Shar needs her warriors strong and ready.*
AD_Plaque.context: NodeContext: Plaque text at barracks/dining hall of a Shar temple

session_synopses.AD_Plaque: This is a plaque placed in the section of barracks and dining halls and altar in Shar temple. Wise words to acolytes to have priestine thoughts and behavior

JusticiarAppears.context:
CinematicNodeContext: A rat transforms into an elf. Its hisses and squeaks morph into the elf's cry of pain as he returns to his true form.

Keep the camera on the player while they react to the transformation

JusticiarAppears.speaker: Lyrthindor
JusticiarAppears.text: These hands... too big. Where are the others? Where's the rest of me?!
JusticiarAppears.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at his own hands in confusionNodeContext: Groan of pain followed by anger and confusion as he looks down at his own hands in disbelief

JusticiarAppears.speaker: Lyrthindor
JusticiarAppears.text: You - why did you have to keep prying? Why couldn't you just leave?!
JusticiarAppears.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks up from his hands to the player, angryNodeContext: Angry, irrational outburst. Looks up at the player on 'you'.

JusticiarAppears.speaker: Lyrthindor
JusticiarAppears.text: Lyrthindor - last Dark Justiciar. I kept watch over Lady Shar's temple. Kept the faith alive, after all the others were killed.

JusticiarAppears.speaker: Lyrthindor
JusticiarAppears.text: But you ruined it. Trespassed. Spoiled our - my - secret. Now you'll rot in the dark.
JusticiarAppears.context: NodeContext: Furious. Still mixed up, referring to himself in plural then correcting. Turns hostile immediately afterwards

JusticiarAppears.speaker: Player
JusticiarAppears.text: I'm sorry. What more can be said?

JusticiarAppears.speaker: Lyrthindor
JusticiarAppears.text: Nothing. You had your chance to talk - now you die.
JusticiarAppears.context: NodeContext: Furious. Turns hostile immediately afterwards

session_synopses.AD_UltimatumLure: The player can hear rats' squeaks and hisses coming from the bottom of the Shar Temple. This is meant to lure the player to the bottom of the temple.At this point the player has killed multiple rats and refused to negotiate with them.
session_synopses.JusticiarAppears: After killing the final rat during the Ultimatum stage, one of the final rats returns to its humanoid form as Lyrthindor,  the Last Justiciar. He's furious that the player has blown his cover, and quickly turns hostile.

AD_MonitorLeaves.speaker: Raphael

AD_MonitorLeaves.context: NodeContext: mildly irritated, said right before he teleports away

session_synopses.AD_MonitorLeaves: Raphael leaves while at the front of Shar Temple, in case he is attacked.

Altar.speaker: Shadowheart
Altar.text: There's nothing more for us to do here - not until we complete Lady Shar's trials.

PAD_ShadowheartVista.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartVista.text: Lady Shar... so many must have toiled to make a visage so grand. It's beautiful...
PAD_ShadowheartVista.context: NodeContext: Overawed at the sight of a statue of liberty-sized representation of Shar, in  the heart of a huge temple.

session_synopses.Altar: The player approaches an altar dedicated to Shar. This altar is a call to action for the player to complete Shar's trials and become a Dark Justiciar.
session_synopses.PAD_ShadowheartVista: Shadowheart sees the giant Shar Statue and lets it set in that she is in the temple of shar.

PAD_VoiceReaction.speaker: Player
PAD_VoiceReaction.text: A voice... is that Shar herself, who speaks...?

AD_Welcome.text: Welcome, child. Follow my voice, and prove your worth.

session_synopses.PAD_VoiceReaction: Party reacts to Shar's voice in the temple and acknowledging it is Shar's voice.
session_synopses.AD_Welcome: The player is welcomed to the Shar Temple by a disembodied voice

PAD_Prayer.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_Prayer.text: Just a little bit farther. See my actions, Lady Shar. Hear my words of faith.
PAD_Prayer.context: NodeContext: Urging herself on. Final descent

AD_MartialPlaque.speaker: Narrator
AD_MartialPlaque.text: *Deliver the Night Mother's mercy upon her enemies.*

AD_NecroUnavailable.speaker: Nightsong
AD_NecroUnavailable.text: I smell the stink of Balthazar. Bring him to me.
AD_NecroUnavailable.context: NodeContext: She can do an ostentatiouse 'sniff' sound like a pro wrestler insulting an enemy

AD_EntrancePlaque.speaker: Narrator
AD_EntrancePlaque.text: *Spill the blood of Sel√ªne and rise a warrior of Shar.*
AD_EntrancePlaque.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if the player didn't already know Nightsong was a living beingNodeContext: The text of a plaque, instructing initiates in a sharran rite.

ArriveAtShadowfell.speaker: Shadowheart
ArriveAtShadowfell.text: Lady Shar... I can feel her all around. This is her domain. This is the Shadowfell.

ArriveAtShadowfell.speaker: Balthazar
ArriveAtShadowfell.text: You cleared the way for me, True Soul. What promising flesh you are. As a reward, I shall let you bear witness to my masterpiece.
ArriveAtShadowfell.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Please restrict hip and leg movement for this line. He will be floating as he speaks.

Balthazar appears behind the player through the entrance from Shar Temple to Nightsong's prison. He's levitating and reaches their side before they can react, InternalNodeContext: Fallback - haven't met balthazar in person or agreed to helpNodeContext: High-handed, pleased with himself

ArriveAtShadowfell.speaker: Shadowheart
ArriveAtShadowfell.text: This is the Dark Lady's domain - he does not belong here.
ArriveAtShadowfell.context: NodeContext: Addressed to player re: Balthazar. Disdain.

AD_Plaque3.speaker: Narrator
AD_Plaque3.text: *In her blood be anointed: Dark Justiciar.*

PAD_EnteredShadowfell.speaker: Player
PAD_EnteredShadowfell.text: I feel lighter, unburdened, as if the softest push could send me drifting away.

NecroAndNightsong.speaker: Nightsong
NecroAndNightsong.text: Balthazar. Come to add more bars to my cage.
NecroAndNightsong.context: CinematicNodeContext: She paces the narrow cage where she's kept, like a tiger. She looks down as she paces, not yet deigning to make eye contact.

NecroAndNightsong.speaker: Nightsong
NecroAndNightsong.text: Or perhaps to lead this would-be Justiciar's blade directly to my heart?
NecroAndNightsong.context: CinematicNodeContext:  On "this Justiciar"," abruptly turns to the player and points an accusing finger. As she moves forward out of position, magical hands grab around her wrists arms and shoulers, holding her back. She looks down at them and grimaces in rage, then steps back into place. This is how she's bound: If she moves too far, she'll be pulled back by the magi-hands.

NecroAndNightsong.speaker: Nightsong
NecroAndNightsong.text: I invite you: heap more sins upon your head. My retribution will be all the sweeter for them.
NecroAndNightsong.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stock still. Cold. Staring Balthazar dead in the eyes.NodeContext: With a deep, seething foreboding

NecroAndNightsong.speaker: Balthazar
NecroAndNightsong.text: All this time, and you still fail to appreciate the gifts I bestowed on you, Aylin. Sad, to see a thing of beauty not recognise its own worth.
NecroAndNightsong.context: CinematicNodeContext: Displeased poutNodeContext: A little displeased and admonishing

NecroAndNightsong.speaker: Balthazar
NecroAndNightsong.text: But General Thorm - he appreciates you. And he wants you close at hand, so I am here to whisk you back to him.
NecroAndNightsong.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brightening upNodeContext: Tone brightening up a little

NecroAndNightsong.speaker: Nightsong
NecroAndNightsong.text: Ketheric. I welcome the sight of him, after these hundred years. He whose immortality I supply with my very soul.
NecroAndNightsong.context: NodeContext: She spits on the floor of her cage after 'Ketheric'

NecroAndNightsong.speaker: Balthazar
NecroAndNightsong.text: General. Thorm. I'm sure you'll be on your best behaviour for him. But just in case, I've taken some precautions.

NecroAndNightsong.speaker: Balthazar
NecroAndNightsong.text: Keep back. It will take quite some concentration to secure Aylin for her little journey.

NecroAndNightsong.speaker: Shadowheart
NecroAndNightsong.text: The Nightsong is Shar's sacrifice - she's my destiny. He cannot have her!
NecroAndNightsong.context: NodeContext: Urgent. Her sacred mission is in jeopardy

PAD_ShadowfellEntrance.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowfellEntrance.text: This must be where initiates undertook their final preparations. The end is near.
PAD_ShadowfellEntrance.context: NodeContext: Focus/mounting anticipation. Arc: SH is loyal to Shar

PAD_NightsongsFateReaction.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction.context:
NodeContext: Karlach: High derision. She doesn't support what just happened.
Halsin - bitter

PAD_NightsongsFateReaction.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction.text: I hope your goddess is pleased.

PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_2.speaker: Player
PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_2.text: Alive - and abandoned in this place for a very long time.

AD_NecroAndNightsong.speaker: Nightsong
AD_NecroAndNightsong.text: Hatred makes you so hideous, Balthazar.

AD_NecroAndNightsong.speaker: Balthazar
AD_NecroAndNightsong.text: Unkind, Aylin. Unkind and incorrect - I could never hate my masterwork.

AD_NecroAndNightsong.speaker: Nightsong
AD_NecroAndNightsong.text: Perhaps you're right - perhaps you're incapable of feeling at all.

AD_NecroAndNightsong.speaker: Balthazar
AD_NecroAndNightsong.text: Please, Aylin - spare me. Your insults grew tired and shopworn years ago.

NightsongFreed.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongFreed.text:
Our Lady of Silver. Hear me!
She Who Guides, the Moonmaiden Sel√ªne -
MOTHER OF THE SO-CALLED NIGHTSONG.
THE NIGHTSONG IS NO MORE!
NightsongFreed.context:
CinematicNodeContext: She kneels, head down, allowing the player to lay a hand upon her shoulder. As the hand makes contact, the hands appear upon her again - they glow and burs/ fade awayt. She steps forward nervously and stumbles, not having been free in a century and momentarily dizzied by the prospect of it. She catches herself on hand and knees, her head hanging. She begins to beat the ground with a fist in a slow, powerful rhythm. Then, she begins to hum an ancient, almost Gregorian chant. As she hums, the sound of it echoing through the Shadowfell builds and morphs into a chorus humming in harmony with her. She raises herself to her feet, but the rhythm continues, as does the song, independently of her.

As the music swells, Nightsong raises her voice in an invocation
NodeContext: Shouted to the heavens.

NightsongFreed.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongFreed.context:
CinematicNodeContext: A moonbeam lands on Nightsong, like a spotlight. She begins to glow as the music swells and reaches its climax.
Within the moonbeam, she transforms. Her wounds heal, and her rusted, dirty armour and torn clothes begin to mend.
The ragged, violently marred costume she was wearing is replaced, piece by piece, with the shining armour of a paladin of Selune.The spotlight on Nightsong fades. She is renewed, beautiful, powerful.

NodeContext: With joy and gratitiude. Not ego, but fact.

session_synopses.PAD_Prayer: Shadowheart recites verses of a prayer to Shar as she draws closer to Nightsong.This is a prayer that SH may have recited previously, now repeated as SH gets past the final hurdles to fulfill Shar's bidding. Urging herself on for the 'final lap'.

Balthazar makes his way down towards Nightsong. Variant lines for:1. Met Balthazar in person, agreed to help2. Met Balthazar in person, didn't agree to help 3. Fallback (likely skipped meeting Balthazar)If Balthazar is dead then the player is just shown a cinematic shot of the Shadowfell
session_synopses.AD_Plaque3: This is a plaque with narrator AD near the soul cage - before the final trial of killing the Selunite to finish Dark Justiciar training. There are total 3 of them so information needs to be divided nicely.

session_synopses.PAD_ShadowfellEntrance: Entered the final hall before entering the shadowfell in the shar temple. The area used to be used for Dark Justiciars to wash themselves, conduct last prayers and arming themselves before entering the waters into the shadowfell.

session_synopses.PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_2: The player has read the plaque outside the entrance to Nightsong's Prison and the characters are reacting appropriately:- discovering Nightsong is a living being for the first time- confirming that same fact after learning it elsewhere- if Shadowheart, iterating her desire to sacrifice Nightsong/retrieve the spear required to do so.- reacting to Shadowheart‚Äôs desire to sacrifice Nightsong to Shar, with variables depending on if they‚Äôre just learning Nightsong is a living being here or not.

Face_Guilt.speaker: Visage of Guilt

Face_Guilt.speaker: Player
Face_Guilt.text: Yes. But I guess you didn't.

Face_Guilt.speaker: Visage of Guilt

Face_Guilt.speaker: Visage of Guilt

Face_Guilt.speaker: Player

session_synopses.AD_Face_Cowardice: The Visage of Cowardice is hiding in the secret lair, hoping that nobody will find it. Speaks with the same voice as the shadow-cursed tollmaster, but with a distinct emotional inflectoin. Cowardice, in this case.

LootBoss.speaker: Narrator
LootBoss.text: *The corpse is saturated with darkness, flesh and bone corrupted by a dense concentration of Shadow Weave. Sharran magic, summoned from beyond the Weave's boundaries. Beyond Mystra's control.*
LootBoss.context: CinematicNodeContext: VFX of dark shadow magic reflecting flashing over Gale's face. Gale reacts.

LootBoss.speaker: Narrator
LootBoss.text: *Left alone, its corruption will leak and spread. You could nullify it, preventing such harm as Mystra would want. Or you could absorb it, tasting Shar's forbidden magic for yourself.*

LootBoss.speaker: Gale
LootBoss.text: Cleanse the corpse. Destroy this tainted power.

LootBoss.speaker: Narrator
LootBoss.text: *A blast of purest Weave is enough to banish the shadow magic trapped beneath the corpse's skin.*
LootBoss.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale focuses. Bright, white VFX (reading as morally good).

LootBoss.speaker: Narrator
LootBoss.text: *As its blight fades, you feel a lightness rush in to take its place - Mystra. A taste of what you lost and of what awaits you for fulfilling her purpose.*

session_synopses.LootBoss: Gale (or someone near Gale) has attempted to loot a corpse and Gale realises the evil possibilities.

LeavingAct.speaker: Narrator
LeavingAct.text: *The curse has been lifted, the lands cleansed of the shadows. Ketheric's reign of living death is over.*
LeavingAct.context: CinematicNodeContext: Players leave SCL by the Risen Road. They look back to see beams of light breaking through the clouds.-The curse has been lifted. The clouds above part, and a powerful beam of moonlight shines through and illuminates the town centre where the statue of Ketheric stood. It is now shattered.

LeavingAct.speaker: Narrator
LeavingAct.text: *Your courage has been tested, and in this, at least, you have triumphed.*
LeavingAct.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cut to close up of the shattered statue. An enormous silver tree bursts through the ground where the statue once stood, silver leaves/fruits sprouting, and the light from above intensifies as the shadows disperse.

CinematicNodeContext: Cut back to party, with Halsin in shot, looking across the rejuvenating region. Halsin takes front and centre, looking back across the 'healed'vista, overjoyed, and then the party turn and continue their journey

session_synopses.LeavingAct: Scene of players leaving SCL to travel to Intermezzo. This scene triggers when the party leave Moonrise Tower after defeating Ketheric. There are two variants. One where the curse has been lifted, one where the curse hasn't been lifted.If the curse has been lifted, Halsin and/or Art Cullagh will be present at Moonrise if alive, and will tell players that the quest has succeeded, and that when they leave Moonrise, they'll see the restults. They tell you to wrap up your business here first. This happens in the dialogues for those characters, not here.If the curse hasn't been lifted, players see a vista of the shadow-cursed lands on leaving Moonrise, and move on toward the Risen Road.
session_synopses.PAD_ArmyLeft: Comment on how the absolute army left. Reactivity if you saw them previously or not.

session_synopses.PlaqueOfIntelligence: Secret room in SCL_Main_A, beneath the Central Square. This statue has a dogma of Shar and asks you whether you accept it. Accepting it require a saving throw, on a failure you get a debuff and guardians appear. If you are a follower of Shar / Shadowheart you get have a special option which gives you auto-success.
session_synopses.Plaque_001_AD: One of the plaque in the Central Square.You need to click on the 3 plaques in a correct sequence to unlock a secret entrance to the secret room underneath the central square.The correct sequence: 2-3-1The plaques should either tell the history of Ketheric Thorm / this outpost or be some sort of propaganda.
session_synopses.PAD_ExitLocked: This PAD is played when you try to exit the secret room beneath the central square after three guardians were revealed to you, but before you defeated them.
session_synopses.PAD_PlaqueFirstUse: Clicking on one of the plaquet at the central square in Town for the first time. The plaques must be pressed in the right order to unlock a secret room, and have what looks like nonsense written on them, but is actually the clue to the order.
session_synopses.PAD_EnteredSanctuary: This PAD is played when you enter the secret Shar sanctuary beneath the Central Sqaure of the Town. It's free of the Shadow Curse and the player character comments on that.
session_synopses.AD_Justiciar: There are piles and individual skeletons in justiciar —Åuirass scattered across the Town and SCL. We can click some of the most posing of them to get little narrator comment. Shadowheart may have followed up on this if we know about her justiciar connection.
session_synopses.Plaque_002_AD: One of the plaque in the Central Square.You need to click on the 3 plaques in a correct sequence to unlock a secret entrance to the secret room underneath the central square.The correct sequence: 2-3-1The plaques should either tell the history of Ketheric Thorm / this outpost or be some sort of propaganda.

AD_Surgeon_SuccessfulSurgery_Combat.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon_SuccessfulSurgery_Combat.text: A successful procedure, Shar be praised!

AD_Surgeon_Leech_Combat.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon_Leech_Combat.text: Behold - the leech, for draining humours most foul.

AD_Surgeon_InstrumentRequest_002_Combat.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon_InstrumentRequest_002_Combat.text: The subject resists. Next instrument, good sister.

Reception_Receptionist.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist.text: Here to see the doctor? Are we poorly? Are we desperately poorly?

Reception_Receptionist.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist.text: Not so well. But well enough to wait. Join the line, and you will be seen.
Reception_Receptionist.context: CinematicNodeContext: The nurse 'looks' you over, assessing your condition.InternalNodeContext: Upon investigation, deduces that you're not that sick.

Reception_Receptionist.speaker: Player
Reception_Receptionist.text: I don't have time to wait - I need to see the doctor right now.

Reception_Receptionist.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist.text: Yes yes, but all must wait. The doctor's hands are full.

Reception_Receptionist.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist.text: Join the line - you will be seen.
Reception_Receptionist.context: NodeContext: with a touch of desperation

Reception_Receptionist.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist.text: Poor creature - so sad, so sick.

Reception_Receptionist.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist.text: The doctor will see you. The doctor will soothe.

Reception_Receptionist.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist.text: Down to the theatre, be swift, be saved.

ZealousAssistant_003_AD.speaker: Sister Anya
ZealousAssistant_003_AD.text: Can you feel it? The hurting?

ZealousAssistant_003_AD.speaker: Sister Anya
ZealousAssistant_003_AD.text: Here, darling. Let me soothe the pain.

AD_Surgeon_InstrumentRequest_004_Combat.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon_InstrumentRequest_004_Combat.text: This flesh must be flayed. The next instrument, sister.

Reception_CorpseTender.speaker: Sister Lidwin
Reception_CorpseTender.text: Don't call the doctor yet! I've got potions, sutures - I know I can do this...
Reception_CorpseTender.context: InternalNodeContext: She doesn't see you coming, but from the sound of your footsteps thinks you might be the doctor. NodeContext: The nurse is panicking assuming you are a patient

Reception_CorpseTender.speaker: Sister Lidwin
Reception_CorpseTender.text: Oh, you're a patient. This is the children's ward - triage is back that way.
Reception_CorpseTender.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mid-inspection, the nurse notices you. NodeContext: Mid-inspection, the nurse notices the player.

AD_Surgeon_InstrumentRequest_001_Combat.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon_InstrumentRequest_001_Combat.text: Sister. The first instrument, if I may.

AD_Surgeon_Trepan_Combat.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon_Trepan_Combat.text: Blood has pooled in the brain. I must open the cranium!

ZealousAssistant_001_AD.speaker: Sister Geanne
ZealousAssistant_001_AD.text: He is absent. Abscence is him.
ZealousAssistant_001_AD.context: NodeContext: Weird outbursts. Her mind is lost. Not loud, just intense

Patient_AD.speaker: Distressed Patient
Patient_AD.context: NodeContext: Gurgling - tongue has been torn out

AD_Surgeon.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon.text: Only with unwavering hand can we show our subject mercy.
AD_Surgeon.context: NodeContext: speaking to nurses as he demonstrates surgical procedure

AD_Surgeon_InstrumentRequest_003_Combat.speaker: Sister Anya
AD_Surgeon_InstrumentRequest_003_Combat.context: NodeContext: 'Sister?' = expectantly, asking for his next surgical tool.

PAD_Entrance_1P.speaker: Player
PAD_Entrance_1P.text: A house of healing, for all the good it does anyone now.

AD_Surgeon_Bonesaw_Combat.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon_Bonesaw_Combat.text: Still yourself. The saw's teeth will open the way for her shadow.

RooftopRaven.speaker: Narrator
RooftopRaven.text: |*The raven is unnerved by your presence and clearly wants you to leave*|

RooftopRaven.speaker: Player
RooftopRaven.text: |*Just prepare to fight raven for no good reason*|

session_synopses.PAD_SurgeonDead: PAD is played after Surgeon is dead.Variations: - Killed by Nurses; - Killed himself; - Killed in combat;
session_synopses.Reception_Receptionist: Receptionist at the entrance of the Hospital. She's mostly supposed to be there for flavor and to provide directions to the operating room (down the hallway and under the observation area.) If you piss her off or try to circumvent her to see the doctor, she'll fight you.
session_synopses.ZealousAssistant_003_AD: Nurses only speak if the Surgeon is dead.Case #1 They operated on the Surgeon and killed him.Case #2.The player killed the Surgeon and ran away. The nurses now have ADs.
session_synopses.ZealousAssistant_002: One of the nurses in the HospitalMUTE (maybe just can't talk or maybe lost her tongue to the surgeon)
session_synopses.Reception_CorpseTender: A nurse is tending to the corpse of Arabella's father, one of the rejected/failed experiments of the Surgeon. She is insistent that it makes sense, even though the corpse is well... a corpse. The player can trade with this nurse.
session_synopses.ZealousAssistant_001_AD: Nurses only speak if the Surgeon is dead.Case #1 They operated on the Surgeon and killed him.Case #2.The player killed the Surgeon and ran away. The nurses now have ADs.
session_synopses.Patient_AD: Patiens has no tongue or eyes. If you release him he produces some sounds, walks a couple of feet and dies from blood loss.
session_synopses.AD_Surgeon: Surgeon in the Hospital in the Cursed Town operates on a goblin restrained in a chair.OR comments about patients if the goblin is dead (released).
session_synopses.PAD_Entrance_1P: VB that is played when you approach the Hospital in SCL

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Missing - 'Zola'. 'Rascal'. Why do those names sounds familiar? Oh - the blood-stained collars...

session_synopses.PAD: Character interacts with a board of posters outlining many pets who have gone missing in the town in the shadowlands.

PAD_MausoleumEntry.speaker: Player
PAD_MausoleumEntry.text: These sigils... what were they for?

session_synopses.PAD_MausoleumEntry: On approaching the Thorm Mausoleum in SCL, characters comment on the sigils placed around the entrance of the Mausoleum. Halsin, Minthara, Shadowheart, Druids and Selune followers have more context on what they are seeing.

Brewer_Zombie_01.speaker: Blighted Barman
Brewer_Zombie_01.text: D-do mess our pardon. Our master d-distiller spill's quite the caused.

Brewer_Zombie_01.speaker: Blighted Barman
Brewer_Zombie_01.text: Now settle your mind, chum, and get your shine on. Be will it what?

Brewer_Zombie_01.speaker: Blighted Barman
Brewer_Zombie_01.text: M-moon Mountain Dark, coming righ-righ-right up. A man of proper t-taste!
Brewer_Zombie_01.context: NodeContext: Stuck on repeat, going through the motions and 'glitching out'.

ResearchNotes.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes.text: *Research notes. They describe a powerful venom extracted from a rare purple worm. Distiller Thisobald Thorm sought to create a fatal poison using the worm's gullet.*

ResearchNotes.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes.text: *He procured several parts of a gullet, but rinsed one in error. The poison he brewed was noxious - but not fatal.*

ResearchNotes.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes.text: *He devoted months to formulating a deadly poison with the remaining ingredients, without success.*

ResearchNotes.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes.text: *After exhaustive experimentation, he was able to make a near-deadly extract from the glands. But to complete his poison, Thisobald required one last ingredient:*

ResearchNotes.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes.text: *The book's index reveals corpse roses may grow near tombs, mausoleums, and particularly redolent cadavers.*

ResearchNotes.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes.text: *Thisobald enlisted a courier from Baldur's Gate to obtain corpse rose petals and other ingredients and deliver them to a covert location.*

ResearchNotes.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes.text: *Unfortunately, a deep purple stain darkens the final page, obscuring the parcel's destination.*

ResearchNotes.speaker: Player
ResearchNotes.text: Focus your eyes on the page. Mentally separate the blank ink from the purple stain.

ResearchNotes.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes.text: *Your mind separates the black from the blue, revealing the stash's location. You mark your map as a reminder.*

ResearchNotes.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes.text: *With the corpse rose petals the package contains, you might create Thisobald's purple worm poison.*

PAD_Brewer_Poison.speaker: Player
PAD_Brewer_Poison.text: Hells - his brew's turned to poison.

AD_Brewer_Zombie_02.speaker: Blighted Patron
AD_Brewer_Zombie_02.text: Finally, there might be some more drink for the rest of us.
AD_Brewer_Zombie_02.context: NodeContext: reflecting on the fact the brewer just died, but with little emotion

AD_Brewer_Zombie_03.speaker: Blighted Troubador
AD_Brewer_Zombie_03.text: Drink has torn his mortal stitches - Say, hey, for the pub!
AD_Brewer_Zombie_03.context: NodeContext: referring to the brewer, who just died

AD_Brewer_Hallucinating_001_Combat.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
AD_Brewer_Hallucinating_001_Combat.text: Imps! No, no - illusions, delusions, delirium.

PAD_Entrance_1P.speaker: Player
PAD_Entrance_1P.text: That sign above. This must be a brewery - or distillery.

AD_Brewer_Zombie_04.speaker: Blighted Actor
AD_Brewer_Zombie_04.text: Wait... what am I doing here again?

AD_Brewer_Necro_Combat.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
AD_Brewer_Necro_Combat.text: Drink of dead, dying, death. Order up.

PAD_ArmInBarrel.speaker: Player
PAD_ArmInBarrel.text: Is that... a human arm? Do I even want to know?

PAD_Brewer_Hallucinating.speaker: Player
PAD_Brewer_Hallucinating.text: Is that... yes! His hallucinations made real.

PAD_BrewerDead.speaker: Player
PAD_BrewerDead.text: Pity we had to kill him. He seemed more lonely than cruel.

Brewer_Zombie_04.speaker: Blighted Actor
Brewer_Zombie_04.text: One day I'll get there... one day...

Brewer_Zombie_04.speaker: Player
Brewer_Zombie_04.text: What are you doing up here on this stage?

Brewer_Zombie_04.speaker: Blighted Actor
Brewer_Zombie_04.text: Isn't it obvious! I'm a... I stand on a stage, pretending...
Brewer_Zombie_04.context: NodeContext: hesitant, trying to find the right words, but is cursed to forget

Brewer_Zombie_04.speaker: Player
Brewer_Zombie_04.text: You mean you're an actor? How did you end up here?

Brewer_Zombie_04.speaker: Blighted Actor
Brewer_Zombie_04.text: I was... performing... and then the lights went out. I'm waiting for the curtain call.

Brewer.context: CinematicNodeContext: The brewer drags itself to a bar counter, on which are two full mugs.

Brewer.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer.text: Drink, gulp it down, wet your whistle. Tell your story.
Brewer.context: NodeContext: Twisted and creepy, a jovial barman who has been corrupted by curse.

Brewer.speaker: Player
Brewer.text: What in all Nine Hells are you?

Brewer.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer.text: Son of Thorm. Sot of Sword Coast.

Brewer.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer.text: Go on. Cheers, bottoms up, down the hatch.
Brewer.context: NodeContext: still an offer, but becoming more of a threat

Brewer_Zombie_02.speaker: Blighted Patron
Brewer_Zombie_02.text: I don't know you... perhaps I forgot you.

session_synopses.Brewer_Zombie_01: A zombie who was once the waiter. He is stuck on repeat, going through the motions and 'glitching out'.
session_synopses.ResearchNotes: Research notes of the Brewer.He experimented with different poisons on different creatures, trying to figure out the most effective ways of poisoning them. This book also contains info about his attempts to create a Purple Worm Poison.
session_synopses.PAD_Brewer_Poison: Played during the fight with the Brewer.
session_synopses.AD_Brewer_Zombie_02: One of the zombie patrons in the Brewery. Just wandering around.He's been trapped in the shadow-curse for a hundred years, and has been drained of most of his emotions. What lingers is a sense of sadness - he misses the joy of the old times.
session_synopses.AD_Brewer_Zombie_03: Zombie Patron #3 in BreweryTroubador singing/chanting drinking rhymes.
session_synopses.AD_HalflingsSign: Plaque that says "Halfings and gnomes order here."
session_synopses.PAD_Entrance_1P: VB that is played when you approach the Distillery in SCL
session_synopses.AD_Brewer: Brewer in Shadow-Cursed Town. Waiting for someone to join him as he stands behind the bar.The brewer was once an ordinary person, but has been twisted by the shadowcurse and is now a huge, bloated monstrosity. He speaks in fragments, and is menacing but with an air of melancholy. He wants to drink until he forgets everything, and would like to bring everyone into oblivion with him.
session_synopses.AD_WaningMoonSign: Click on the sign of Distillery in TWN
session_synopses.AD_Brewer_Zombie_04: Zombie Patron #4 in Brewery. Used to be an actor, was on her way to Baldur's Gate. Like the other patrons in the brewery, she's been trapped in the shadow-curse for a hundred years, and is mostly drained of emotions.
session_synopses.PAD_ArmInBarrel: There is a barrel with an arm sticking out of it, Clicking on it makes the characters comment. The comment is different depending on whether the player has read the Brewer's diary.
session_synopses.PAD_Brewer_Hallucinating: Played during the fight with the Brewer.
session_synopses.PAD_BrewerDead: In Town in Act 2 we meet the Brewer that is son of Ketheric and shadow-curse mutated. This one is played when we defeat him
session_synopses.Brewer_Zombie_04: One of the zombie patrons in the Brewery. This is an actor whose heart was set on the Five Flagons in Baldur's Gate, but he got lost in his cups here.
session_synopses.Brewer: Dialog with the Brewer. He is a bloated creature who asks us to drink ourselves into oblivion with him. Player choices lead either to combat, or to the brewer drinking himself until he explodes.Twisted and creepy, a jovial barman who has been corrupted by curse to become a monstrous drunk. He speaks in fragments, swinging between melancholy, menace, and humour. Extra emphasis and derangment on bold words.
session_synopses.Brewer_Zombie_02: One of the zombie patrons in the Brewery. Just wandering around.

AD.speaker: Narrator
AD.text: *Reithwin House of Healing. Presiding Surgeon: Malus Thorm.*

PAD.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD.text: Rambling nonsense. Why someone would be drawn to this is beyond me.

session_synopses.PAD: ShadowHeart reacting on reading"Selune Prayer Book"Location: SCL -> Tollhouse - Seized Inventory Room.She reacts both when she reads the book or when another character does that.

AD.speaker: Narrator
AD.context: NodeContext: RYTH-win. Like rye bread, not wreath. TH like in 'thick', not like in 'those'.

session_synopses.AD: Just a note from a fisherman.
